techmeme.title: YouTube announces AI detection tools to protect creators from having their likeness copied and plans to give creators controls over AI scraping (Sarah Perez/TechCrunch)
OpenAI says it now has 1M+ paid users for the corporate versions of ChatGPT, including ChatGPT Team, Enterprise, and Edu (Rachel Metz/Bloomberg)
The US, UK, EU, and others sign a Council of Europe treaty to ensure that the use of AI is "fully consistent with human rights, democracy and the rule of law" (Ingrid Lunden/TechCrunch)
Sources: Huawei and SMIC are struggling with making chips for Huawei's next flagship Mate 70, due to US restrictions; Huawei was aiming for a September release (Qianer Liu/The Information)
DJI unveils Neo, a $200 drone aimed at content creators and casual users with features like palm takeoff, voice control, ActiveTrack, smartphone control, more (Steve Dent/Engadget)
